avdta.network.link

Class LTMLink

  • java.lang.Object
    • avdta.network.link.Link
      • avdta.network.link.LTMLink
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Link>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CACCLTMLink, PQLink

    public class LTMLink
extends Link
    This class implements the link transmission model. It uses ChainedArrays to store cumulative counts at the upstream and downstream ends, and stores vehicles in a LinkedList.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • LTMLink

        public LTMLink(int id,
               Node source,
               Node dest,
               double capacity,
               double ffspd,
               double wavespd,
               double jamd,
               double length,
               int numLanes)
        Constructs the link with the given parameters
        Parameters:
        id - the link id
        source - the source node
        dest - the destination node
        capacity - the capacity per lane (veh/hr)
        ffspd - the free flow speed (mi/hr)
        wavespd - the congested wave speed (mi/hr)
        jamd - the jam density (veh/mi)
        length - the length (mi)
        numLanes - the number of lanes

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        Initializes this LTMLink after all data is read. This creates the ChainedArrays used to store cumulative counts.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets this LTMLink to restart the simulation. This clears the ChainedArrays
        Overrides:
        reset in class Link

      • step

        public void step()
        Executes one time step of simulation. This updates the current upstream and downstream capacities. Adding and removing vehicles occurs through Nodes.
        Overrides:
        step in class Link

      • getQueue

        public java.util.LinkedList<VehTime> getQueue()
        Returns the queue of Vehicles. The queue is stored as a LinkedList of VehTimes, which contain the Vehicle arrival times used to determine sending flows.
        Returns:
        the queue of Vehicles
